accuracy.description: The degree to which the answered question matches the expected correct response based on the provided information or data.

completeness.description: The extent to which all required steps were performed and all necessary elements were included in the response.

reasoning_traceability.description: The ability to follow the logic and steps taken by the agent to arrive at the final answer.

adherence_to_instructions.description: How closely the agent followed the specific instructions provided in the task, such as formatting and listing requirements.

diversity_of_steps.description: The variety of the steps taken to answer the question, demonstrating that the solution could not have been brute-forced.

non_redundancy.description: Ensuring that steps taken do not repeat unnecessarily and contribute to the final outcome.

data_contamination_avoidance.description: The extent to which the solution avoids using information that could be contaminated, such as direct internet search results.

speed_of_execution.description: The time taken to perform the task, from start to completion.

novelty_of_approach.description: The uniqueness and originality of the method used to solve the task.
